intro: Solidago ceretanica, commonly known as the Ceretanica goldenrod, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust growth habit. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in fine, hairy tissue, and its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges. Its most striking feature is its bright yellow inflorescence, which consists of numerous small ray flowers surrounding a central disk. Solidago ceretanica thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
